sentence.Network_en: He arrived on January 9, disheveled and much the worse for wear.

sentence.Network_en: I can't think of a worse way to spend my time.
sentence.Network_cn: 我想不出更糟的消磨时间的办法。

sentence.Network_en: Don't let yourself despair; this will only make matters worse.
sentence.Network_cn: 不要想不开，这样只能使情况变得更糟。

lj.lj_ly: we were none the worse for our terrible experience.
lj.lj_ls: 我们有过一次可怕的经历但仅此而已。

jx.jx_en_mean: used to suggest a possibility that is still more serious or unpleasant than one already considered, but that the speaker does not wish or need to specify

lj.lj_ly: the child might be born blind or worse.
lj.lj_ls: 那小孩也许天生是个瞎子，或者更糟。

jx.jx_en_mean: used to suggest that a problem, failure, or other unfortunate event or situation is the fault of the person specified and that the speaker does not feel any great concern about it

lj.lj_ly: if they were daft enough to believe it, so much the worse for them.
lj.lj_ls: 如果他们傻到相信这件事，对他们来说就更加不妙了。

lj.lj_ly: he was somewhat the worse for drink at his farewell party.
lj.lj_ls: 他在自己的饯行宴上喝得微醉。

phrase.cizu_name: the worse for wear informal 非正式

jx.jx_en_mean: damaged by use or weather over time; battered and shabby
jx.jx_cn_mean: 穿坏的，用坏的；破旧不堪的

jx.jx_en_mean: (of a person) feeling rather unwell, especially as a result of drinking too much alcohol
jx.jx_cn_mean: （尤指人喝醉后）十分疲倦的，不舒服的

jx.jx_en_mean: in a less advantageous position; less fortunate or prosperous
jx.jx_cn_mean: 情况更坏，处境更糟；更不幸；更贫困

jx.jx_en_mean: Whether the situation or consequences be good or ill
jx.jx_cn_mean: 不管好坏：不管情况或结果是好是坏

lj.lj_ly: For better or worse, he trusts everyone.
lj.lj_ls: 不管怎么样，他相信每个人

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English wyrsa, wiersa (adjective), wiers (adverb), of Germanic origin; related to war

entry.def: Worse is the comparative of bad .
Worse is the comparative of badly .

entry.tran: (用于构成以 bad 和 badly 开头的复合形容词的比较级，如 badly off 的比较级是 worse off )
entry.def: Worse is used to form the comparative of compound adjectives beginning with 'bad' and 'badly.' For example, the comparative of 'badly off' is 'worse off'.
If a situation goes from bad to worse, it becomes even more unpleasant or unsatisfactory.

example.ex: For the past couple of years my life has gone from bad to worse.
example.tran: 过去几年来，我的生活每况愈下。

entry.tran: 不妨(做某事);(做某事)不失明智之举
entry.def: If you tell someone that they could do worse than do a particular thing, you are advising them that it would be quite a good thing to do.

example.ex: Scientists in search of a challenging career could do worse than consider forensic science.
example.tran: 寻求富有挑战性的事业的科学家不妨考虑一下法医学。

entry.tran: 向着更坏(或更糟的)情况(转变)
entry.def: If a situation changes for the worse, it becomes more unpleasant or more difficult.

example.ex: The grandparents sigh and say how things have changed for the worse.
example.tran: 爷爷奶奶叹着气说情况变得如何如何糟糕。

entry.tran: 受到/未受到…的伤害(或不良影响)
entry.def: If a person or thing is the worse for something, they have been harmed or badly affected by it. If they are none the worse for it, they have not been harmed or badly affected by it.

example.ex: Father came home from the pub very much the worse for drink...
example.tran: 父亲从酒吧回到家里，乱撒酒疯。

example.ex: They are all apparently fit and well and none the worse for the fifteen hour journey.
example.tran: 他们的身体状况显然都很好，15个小时的行程没有给他们带来不适。

means.word_mean: 1. something inferior in quality or condition or effect;

sentences.sentence: "accused of cheating and lying and worse"

means.word_mean: 1. (comparative of `bad') inferior to another in quality or condition or desirability;

sentences.sentence: "this road is worse than the first one we took"
"the road is in worse shape than it was"
"she was accused of worse things than cheating and lying"

means.word_mean: 2. changed for the worse in health or fitness;
1. (comparative of `ill') in a less effective or successful or desirable manner;

sentences.sentence: "he did worse on the second exam"

auth_sentence.content: The more you use, the worse the comedowns.
auth_sentence.res_content: The more you use, the worse the comedowns.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The more you use, the worse the comedowns.

auth_sentence.content: But the stick I got was worse at school.
auth_sentence.res_content: But the stick I got was worse at school.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But the stick I got was worse at school.

auth_sentence.content: He makes a worse advert than Lady Thatcher did.
auth_sentence.res_content: He makes a worse advert than Lady Thatcher did.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He makes a worse advert than Lady Thatcher did.

Sentence.sentence: Their school performance was getting worse.
His fall from grace in the 1980s, followed by his return to Apple in 1996 after a period in the wilderness, is an inspiration to any businessperson whose career has taken a turn for the worse.
The subjects who had an audience did worse than the subjects who did alone.
The US economic situation is going from bad to worse.
The good news today is that the bad news is not worse
It has not gone from bad to worse.

means.word_mean: 更坏的, 更糟的, 更差的

sentences.en: I have even worse news for you.
sentences.cn: 我有更坏的消息告诉你。

jushi.english: He has a worse garden than I have.
I have a worse mark than you.
I have even worse news for you.
jushi.chinese: 我有更坏的消息告诉你。
